t: Jeremiah 9
If*pn my head were a flowing spring, my*ln eyes a fountain of tears, I*ln would weep day and night over*ln the slain of my dear people.
If*ln only I had a traveler’s lodging place in*ln the wilderness, I*ln would abandon my people and*ln depart from them, for*ln they are all adulterers, a*ln solemn assembly of treacherous people.

They*pn bent their tongues like their bows; lies*ln and not faithfulness prevail in the land, for*ln they proceed from one evil to another, and*ln they do not take me into account. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Imminent Ruin and Exile
Everyone*pn has to be on guard against his friend. Don’t*ln trust any brother, for*ln every brother will certainly deceive, and*ln every friend spread slander.
Each*ln one betrays his friend; no*ln one tells the truth. They*ln have taught their tongues to speak lies; they*ln wear themselves out doing wrong.
You*ln live in a world of deception. In*ln their deception they refuse to know me. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
Therefore,*p this is what the Lord*s of Armies says: I*pn am about to refine them and test them, for*ln what else can I do because*ln of my dear people?
Their*ln tongues are deadly arrows — they*ln speak deception. With*ln his mouth one*ln speaks peaceably with his friend, but*ln inwardly he sets up an ambush.
Should*ln I not punish them for these things? This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration. Should*pn I not avenge myself on*ln such a nation as this?

I*pn will raise weeping and a lament over*ln the mountains, a*ln dirge over the wilderness grazing land, for*ln they have been so scorched that*ln no one passes through. The*ln sound of cattle is no longer heard. From*ln the birds of the sky to the animals, everything*ln has fled — they have gone away.
I*ln will make Jerusalem a heap of rubble, a*ln jackals’ den. I*ln will make the cities of Judah a desolation, an*ln uninhabited place.
Who*p is the person wise enough to understand this? Who has the Lord*s spoken to, that he may explain it? Why is the land destroyed and scorched like a wilderness, so no one can pass through?
The*p Lord*s said, “It is because they abandoned my instruction, which I set before them, and did not obey my voice or walk according to it.
Instead, they followed the stubbornness of their hearts and followed the Baals as their ancestors taught them.”
Therefore, this is what the Lord*s of Armies, the God of Israel, says: “I am about to feed this people wormwood and give them poisonous water to drink.
I will scatter them among the nations that they and their ancestors have not known. I will send a sword after them until I have finished them off.”
Mourning over Judah
This*p is what the Lord*s of Armies says: Consider,*pn and summon the women who mourn; send*ln for the skillful women.
Let*ln them come quickly to raise a lament over us so*ln that our eyes may overflow with tears, our*ln eyelids be soaked with weeping.
For*ln a sound of lamentation is heard from Zion: How*ln devastated we are. We*ln are greatly ashamed, for*ln we have abandoned the land; our*ln dwellings have been torn down.
Now*pn hear the word of the Lord,*s you women. Pay*ln attention to the words from his mouth. Teach*ln your daughters a lament and*ln one another a dirge,
for*ln Death has climbed through our windows; it*ln has entered our fortresses, cutting*ln off children from the streets, young*ln men from the squares.
“Speak*p as follows: ‘This is what the Lord*s declares: Human corpses will fall like manure on the surface of the field, like newly cut grain after the reaper with no one to gather it.
Boast in the Lord
“‘This*p is what the Lord*s says: The*pn wise person should not boast in his wisdom; the*ln strong should not boast in his strength; the*ln wealthy should not boast in his wealth.

But*ln the one who boasts should boast in this: that*ln he understands and knows me— that*ln I am the Lord,*s showing faithful love, justice,*ln and righteousness on the earth, for*ln I delight in these things. This*lg is the Lord’s*s declaration.
“‘Look,*p the days are coming — this is the Lord’s*s declaration — when I will punish all the circumcised yet uncircumcised:

Egypt, Judah, Edom, the Ammonites, Moab, and all the inhabitants of the desert who clip the hair on their temples. All these nations are uncircumcised, and the whole house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.’”
